column4: Ratio of Marginal to Average Tax Wedge
column7: Top Marginal Capital Gains Tax Rate (b)

column1: (a) Multiple of the average income at which the highest tax bracket applies, in U.S. dollars (PPP).
(b) After any imputation, credit or offset. When the capital gains tax rate varies by type of asset sold, the tax rate applying to the sale of listed shares after an extended period of time is used.
Australia: Only 50% of capital gains are taxable, thus the applicable top personal income tax is effectively 24.5% instead of 49%.
Germany: On top of the 25% flat tax rate, there is a solidarity surcharge of 5.5% of the tax amount, leading to an effective tax rate of 26.4%.
